units.title: Pre‑differentiation wash and Phase I medium addition (Day 0)
units.text: Day 0. Before initiating the differentiation, first aspirate the culture medium and wash with 1 ml of PBS, before adding 1 ml of the phase I medium (Table 6).
units.rationale: Washing removes residual growth factors that could interfere with the new differentiation cues.

units.title: Phase I medium refresh (Days 2‑3)
units.text: Days 2 and 3. Replace with 1.2 ml of fresh phase 1 medium.
units.rationale: Regular medium changes sustain nutrient supply and maintain appropriate signaling levels.

units.title: Transition to Phase II medium (Day 4)
units.text: On day 4, aspirate the phase I medium and add 1.2 ml of phase II medium (Table 6).
units.rationale: Switching to Phase II provides posterior intermediate mesoderm‑specific signals.

units.title: Phase II medium refresh (Days 5‑6)
units.text: Days 5 and 6. Renew the medium with 1.2 ml of fresh phase II medium.
units.rationale: Consistent exposure to Phase II factors promotes proper mesoderm patterning.

units.title: Transition to Phase III medium (Day 7)
units.text: On day 7, aspirate the phase II medium and add 1.2 ml of phase III medium (Table 6).
units.rationale: Phase III introduces NPC‑inducing cues needed for iNPC specification.

units.title: Phase III medium refresh (Days 8‑9)
units.text: Days 8 and 9. Renew the medium with 1.2 ml of fresh phase III medium.
units.rationale: Maintaining Phase III conditions supports maturation of iNPCs.

units.title: Final wash before dissociation (Day 10)
units.text: Day 10. Aspirate the phase III medium and gently wash the cells with 1 ml of PBS.
units.rationale: PBS wash removes residual growth factors before enzymatic dissociation.

units.title: Accumulate cell dissociation (Day 10)
units.text: Add 0.5 ml of Accumax (pre‑warmed to 37 °C) into the well and then put the plate in a 37 °C incubator for 12 min.
units.rationale: Accumulate enzymatically detaches cells while preserving surface markers for downstream sorting.

units.title: Neutralize Accumax and obtain single‑cell suspension (Day 10)
units.text: After Accumax dissociation, add 0.5 ml of 10% (vol/vol) FBS medium to neutralize the dissociation reaction and pipette up and down gently 10 times to break down the cell clusters into single cells.
units.rationale: FBS stops enzymatic activity and gentle pipetting yields a viable single‑cell suspension.

units.title: Seeding iNPCs for expansion (Day 0 of expansion)
units.text: Day 0. If continuing after FACS (Step 31A or C), count the cells with a TC20 automated cell counter and seed ~120,000 cells per well to one Matrigel‑coated well of a 12‑well plate with 1 ml of hNPSR‑v2 medium.
units.rationale: Accurate seeding density ensures optimal growth and prevents over‑confluence during expansion.
